result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl G Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Daryl G Smith in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF160 & 15CF138.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Rights/Elements.  In 15CF160 defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 30 days in jail, $518.00 costs.  60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  32 days jail credit.  Court considers time served. Repeater enhancer is dismissed.  In 15CF138 defendant plead no contest to Cts. 1 & 3.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Cts. 2 & 4 were dismissed but read in.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years.   AODA and comply, maintain absolute sobriety, and submit a DNA sample. Ct. 1 $243.00 costs, Ct. 3  $518.00 costs.  6 month review.  Report to probation by noon on 6/11/15.  4 days jail credit.
